Adding a New Unit

In the Sample MOD we added a new unit the Elven Warrior.  This unit is available for GDI from the Barracks.  In order to add a new unit to the game there a few steps to follow to make it easier:
  • Try and pick an existing unit that is similar and copy the corresponding units XML file from the CnC3XML files directory to your MOD directory location and rename it to something more appropriate.
  • Edit the XML for this new unit making any changes necessary for your unit’s unique abilities.
  • Create an updated LogicCommand that builds this unit, for example in the Sample MOD we added a file that defines a new LogicCommand that builds the ElfWarrior: 
           <LogicCommand
               Type="UNIT_BUILD"
               id="Command_ConstructGDIElfWarrior">
               <Object>GDIElfWarrior</Object>
           </LogicCommand>

 

This can be defined in any file as long as it’s included in the MOD.xml file.  This will be a recurring theme when working with the MOD SDK you can include these elements pretty much anywhere you like as long as the file is included.

  • Update the LogicCommandSet of the object you’d like to build your new unit, for example in the Sample MOD we updated the GDIBarracks to now be able to build the Elf Warrior:

            The bolded command is the new command used to build the new Elf Warrior unit.

<LogicCommandSet
         id="GDIBarracksCommandSet">
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDIRifleSoldierSquad</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDIMissileSoldierSquad</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDIEngineer</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDIGrenadeSoldierSquad</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDISniperSquad</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDICommando</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDIZoneTrooperSquad</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_ConstructGDIElfWarrior</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_TogglePower</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_SelfRepair</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_Sell</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_SetDefaultBuilding</Cmd>
         <Cmd>Command_SetRallyPoint_Infantry</Cmd>
      </LogicCommandSet>

The Sample MOD also created a new Armor and Weapon template for the Elf Warrior.  These are defined in the files, SampleUpdatedArmor.xml, and SampleUpdatedWeapon.xml, again these templates can be defined in any file as long as its properly included in the MOD.xml file.

Updating an Existing Unit

We do not include an example of updating an exiting unit in the Sample MOD.  The process to do this is quite simple.  Merely copy over the unit you wish to update from your install directory’s CnC3XML folder to your MOD folder.  Include it in your mod.xml file, and update as you wish.  One thing to note when you build the MOD using the BuildMOD bat file you will see some errors involving art that cannot be found this is normal.  These errors are because we don’t include all the raw art assets and Binary Asset Builder cannot find them.  The unit will still function properly, and you can use these assets in new units if you wish.  The new unit will generate the same errors but when the game loads the unit it will find the assets without issue.
